title: New Google Nexus 5 photo leaks | Trusted Reviews
description:
![Nexus 5
2](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-reviews-
placeholder-3.svg)

**We appear to have caught the first real glimpse of the new Google[Nexus
5X](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/lg-nexus-5-2015-release-date-rumours-
news-specs-and-price), courtesy of a leaked snapshot.**

There’s been plenty of talk about the follow-up to last year’s [Nexus
6](https://www.trustedreviews.com/nexus-6-review), and how this year’s large-
screen model is being made by [Huawei](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/lg-
nexus-5-and-huawei-nexus-6-specs-tipped-in-new-leak).

However, it’s also been widely reported that Google is working with LG on a
second, smaller Nexus smartphone. Now we think we know what it looks like.

As pointed out by popular YouTube tech reviewer [Marques
Brownlee](https://twitter.com/MKBHD/status/633092867670544384), Google+ user
[Inno Yudha](https://plus.google.com/109355231408662657913/posts/4DFvi7W6Vgv)
has posted the above (poorly framed and slightly blurry) image of a mysterious
new Nexus phone.

Actually, it isn’t particularly mysterious at all. In fact, its design squares
up with a [render video](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/leaked-lg-
nexus-5-render-suggests-fingerprint-scanner-and-usb-c) that emerged late last
week.

There’s the same rounder, matte, vaguely Lumia-esque rear section; the same
rear-mounted circular motif (which is presumably a fingerprint sensor); and
the same spread-out flash and laser autofocus sensor array.

**SEE ALSO:[Best Android Smartphones
2015](https://www.trustedreviews.com/best-android-phones-1_round-up)**

### Alexa’s new whisper mode rolls out in US today – here’s how to enable it

](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/how-to-enable-alexa-whisper-mode-
echo-3607478 "Alexa’s new whisper mode rolls out in US today – here’s how to
enable it")

  * 

This render was reportedly based on the detailed factory schematics that are
given to accessory makers ahead of a phone’s launch. Now we appear to have
seen the real thing.

Other things to expect from the second-generation Nexus 5 is a 5.2in display,
a USB-C port and dual front-facing speakers.

If previous Nexus smartphone launches are anything to go by, we can expect
confirmation of Google’s plans some time in October.
